result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph James Watters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph James Watters is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph James Watters was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 1.
Court dismisses 15CF527, 15CF488 & 15CF335.
Defendant to report to Probation today February 12, 2016 by 4:00 p.m.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF261, 15CF335, 15CF485, 15CF488, 15CF527 and 15TR5091:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Joseph James Watters appeared. Case called at 2:05 p.m. Court states this is the date and time set for a plea and sentencing hearing. 15TR5091 will be held open at this time. Joint recommendation by both parties. ADA Minser recites the recommendations. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. On case 15CF261, DE pleads NC to Ct 2 Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. On case 15CF485, DE pleads NC to amended Ct. 1- Misd. Bail Jumping. DE pleads NC to Ct. 2 Fraud on Gas Station in 15CF485. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 15CF261, amended Ct. 1 Misdemeanor Bail Jumping in 15CF485 and Ct. 2 Fraud on a gas station. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses 15CF527, 15CF488, 15CF335 and Ct. 1 in 15CF261. Sentencing arguments. 

Crt orders:

In Case 15CF485, Ct.1:
-   S/W 2 years probation. Report by 4:00 p.m. today. Bond will remain until reports to probation
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-  Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Court Costs 
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Ct. 2
- $5.00 forf. plus costs
- Restitution in the amount of $410.63 payable to Super America in New Richmond. Bond in the amount of $250.00 to apply

In Case 15CF261, Ct. 2:
-   S/W 2 years probation. Report by 4:00 p.m. today. Bond will remain until reports to probation
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-  Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Court Costs 
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Case called at 1:33 p.m. ADA McKinley calls Deputy Joshua Stenseth to the stand. S/T Deputy Stenseth employed with St Croix County Sheriff's Dept. Direct by ADA McKinley. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom. Cross by Atty Andrea. Nothing further by either party. Witness excused at 1:47 p.m.  Court based on the testimony given by the officer finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds defendant over for trial. Bond continues.
